talk.author: did:plc:ve3q25p65yscbkqivw2b2dct
talk.utter: How dare they not show up to support the party that never shows up for them?

talk.author: did:plc:ud5juoyba56zrs3nszqjx6t3
talk.utter: But GOP doesn't show up either. I guess that was the 31%? We went from git out the vote to SIT out the vote pretty fast

talk.author: did:plc:ve3q25p65yscbkqivw2b2dct
talk.utter: Because neither party represents the interests of the people. It's very difficult to convince young people to show up when the best you can offer is a chance to choose the lesser evil.

talk.author: did:plc:ve3q25p65yscbkqivw2b2dct
talk.utter: Because neither party represents the interests of the people. It's very difficult to convince young people to show up when the best you can offer is a chance to choose the lesser evil.

talk.author: did:plc:ud5juoyba56zrs3nszqjx6t3
talk.utter: Dems have messaging issues because they DO look out for ordinary people. People over profits

talk.author: did:plc:ve3q25p65yscbkqivw2b2dct
talk.utter: They do the bare minimum, and then fuck over leftists in every primary season. They're a center-right party with deeply entrenched corporate interests. They have a leadership problem. Pelosi was awful and Jeffries is worse. The need some leftists in leadership.

talk.author: did:plc:ve3q25p65yscbkqivw2b2dct
talk.utter: They do the bare minimum, and then fuck over leftists in every primary season. They're a center-right party with deeply entrenched corporate interests. They have a leadership problem. Pelosi was awful and Jeffries is worse. The need some leftists in leadership.

talk.author: did:plc:2l2ykiifazl2syeu6g4ug6br
talk.utter: I think you are confusing House leadership with campaign leadership.  They are two separate things with two separate foci.  That's why you don't see Jeffries heading up the DNC.

talk.author: did:plc:ve3q25p65yscbkqivw2b2dct
talk.utter: You think there's any difference in the mind of the average eligible voter when they're deciding whether or not to show up?

talk.author: did:plc:ve3q25p65yscbkqivw2b2dct
talk.utter: You think there's any difference in the mind of the average eligible voter when they're deciding whether or not to show up?

talk.author: did:plc:2l2ykiifazl2syeu6g4ug6br
talk.utter: People vote for THEIR representatives.  That's what they show up for.  Not some broad philosophical bullshit.  If the person they're voting for helps them, they'll send him/her back.  If he/she doesn't, they'll either not vote or vote against him/her.  It's pretty simple.

talk.author: did:plc:ve3q25p65yscbkqivw2b2dct
talk.utter: Most people don't know who their "representatives" are or how they voted on actual policy. They vote on feelings. Voter are pretty simple-minded.
